newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest spot power flat on lackluster demand.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest spot power flat on lackluster demand.

text.p: Spot electricity prices in the midwestern U.S. on Monday were generally unchanged from Friday's levels due to lackluster demand, market sources said.
An overall cool summer will likely leave peak usage records in the Midwest untested as the season draws to a close after the Labor Day holiday weekend.
But a hot weather system is predicted to reach the upper half of the Midwest next week, while the lower portion is expected to experience normal to cooler-than-normal weather.
Flat demand and ample generating capacity to subdue buying interests today, brokers and marketers said.
"A lot of people are trying to sell," one Midwest-based marketer said.

In the East Central Area Reliability Coordination Agreement (ECAR), non-firm, peak electricity for Tuesday delivery was quoted at $17.50-$18.50 per megawatt hour (MWh), compared with Friday's $18.00 for Monday delivery.
Non-firm, off-peak ECAR power for next-day delivery was discussed in the $10.00-$11.00, flat from Friday.
Next-day electricity for delivery at the border of ECAR and the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland (PJM) Interconnect power pool was offered at $22.00-$23.00.
In the Mid-American Interpool Network (MAIN), non-firm, peak power prices for Tuesday were assessed at $16.50-$17.50, compared with Friday's $18.00 area.
MAIN power for non-firm, off-peak delivery Tuesday was valued at $11.00, compared with Friday's $10.00-$11.00.
In the Mid-Continent Area Power Pool (MAPP), non-firm, peak electricity for Tuesday was quoted at $15.00-$17.00, similar to Friday's $17.00-$18.00 range.
MAPP electricity for non-firm, off-peak delivery was pegged at the $11.00 area.
In the Southwest Pool Pool (SPP), non-firm, peak electricity for Tuesday was quoted at $19.50-$20.00, up from Friday's $18.00-$18.50.
September SPP prices were notationally assessed at $18.50-$19.50.
The ECAR district includes Ohio, Indiana, Kentucky, lower Michigan, western Pennsylvania, northern Tennessee and northwestern Virginia.

The MAPP region is made up of Nebraska, Minnesota, the Dakotas, eastern Montana and western Wisconsin, and the MAIN district includes Illinois, northeastern Missouri, eastern Wisconsin and the Michigan pennisula.
The SPP region includes Kansas, Oklahoma, Louisiana, Arkansas, parts of eastern and northern Texas, southeastern New Mexico, southwestern Missouri and western Mississippi.
